Comments_List: How to do calculus overall, how to approach problems step by step.

Problem sets shouldnt all be graded so intensely. You should have an opportunity to fix missed homework points. Often homework didnt even relate to anything in class, so there should be a focus on connecting in class material to psets.
If they need a slower approach to Calc then yes.

Yes, it is a great course to help get your math credit if you're not as good at math. The teachers are super helpful and work with you to make sure you understand the material, and that your grade reflects your learning.
